*[Bug 18800] Defining R_NO_REMAP_RMATH and calling Rf_*() results in compiler errors*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18800>

--- Comment #5 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
(In reply to Suharto Anggono from comment #4)
This (2nd attachment) makes much sense, too, as indeed "no remap" should not
remap ...

After applying both attachments  (several weeks ago),
I see that from the 2 x 2 combinations (2 *.c files, one with `Rf_` prefix, one
w/o), and with and w/o -DR_NO_REMAP_MATH
indeed 3 work, but using  `logspace_add(a, b)` files in the case of
-DR_NO_REMAP_MATH.

I think this is all as it should be,
so plan to commit, waiting a half a day or so for comments.
